page.title: 15Coniston Slate Quarry
page.content: Burlington Slate Ltd. operate{Bursting {Stone Quarry}at a height of 500m on Coniston Old Man. Usually 12 men work there, producing{light green slate}for roofing, cladding, flooring, etc. The quarry face is drilled with a compressed air wheel{drill,}25mm diameter, and blasted using{black {powder.}Broken rock is moved with a Fiat Allis digger and loaded onto trucks, either to be taken to another quarry to be worked, or tipped on the spoil heap as rubbish. The quarrymen work a 40hr week, from 7.30am to 4.15pm. They have 4 weeks annual holiday plus Bank Holidays. The company's{main office}is in Coniston, from which slate from several quarries in the area is {exported}all over the world. The slate produced ranges from Light Sea Green, through Olive Green to Blue/Black.
